alert.note: Alert for Independence; Jackson; Lawrence (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 10:37AM CST until January 15 at 4:40AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock AR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arkansas... Black River At Black Rock affecting Jackson, Lawrence and Independence Counties. For the Black River...including Corning, Pocahontas, Black Rock... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River at Black Rock. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Low lying cultivated land and pastures in Lawrence, Jackson, and Independence counties flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 16.0 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Black River Black Rock 14.0 9.6 Fri 10 am CS 16.0 10.8 8.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS. The next statement will be issued by Saturday morning at 1045 AM CST.
